title: Over the open Atlantic , Ernesto gains strength as a hurricane
message:
Ernesto picked up strength as a hurricane early Monday as it headed farther out in the Atlantic toward easternmost Canada, but the storm is expected to stay offshore, causing powerful swells, dangerous surf and rip currents along the U.S. East Coast, the National Hurricane Center said.
Ernesto’s maximum sustained winds increased overnight to near 85 mph (140 kph), with higher gusts, the hurricane center said.
Still, swells generated by Ernesto were affecting portions of the Bahamas, Bermuda and the U.S. East Coast, as well as the Canadian Atlantic coast.
Life-threatening surf and rip current conditions are likely in these areas during the next couple of days, the hurricane center said.
Ernesto previously battered the northeastern Caribbean, leaving tens of thousands of people without water in Puerto Rico.

title: Ernesto retains strength as hurricane over open Atlantic
message:
Ernesto picked up strength as a hurricane early Monday as it headed farther out into the Atlantic toward easternmost Canada, but the storm was expected to stay offshore, causing powerful swells, dangerous surf and rip currents along the U.S. East Coast, the National Hurricane Center said.
Ernesto's maximum sustained winds increased Monday to near 90 mph (150 kph), with higher gusts, the hurricane center said.
Swells generated by Ernesto were affecting portions of Bermuda, the U.S. East Coast, as well as the Canadian Atlantic coast.
Life-threatening surf and rip current conditions are likely in these areas during the next couple of days, the hurricane center said.
Forecasters, citing local emergency management, said a 41-year-old man drowned Saturday in a rip current at Surf City, North Carolina.

message:

title: Russian seismologists predict  monster  9 Richter magnitude earthquake
message:
A magnitude 7.1 earthquake struck near Kamchatka Saturday, with the epicenter located in the Pacific Ocean, approximately 108 km southeast of Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, at a depth of around 6 km.
The earthquake was felt in the regional capital, with magnitudes up to six.
Seismologists from the Russian Academy of Sciences warn of an increased likelihood of an even more powerful earthquake, potentially reaching up to 9.0 magnitude, in the Kamchatka region within the next two days.

title: Disaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of Beryl
message:
President Biden has approved a major disaster declaration for Vermont that makes federal funding available to help people and communities affected by flooding from July 9 through July 11 caused by the remnants of Hurricane BerylDisaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of BerylMONTPELIER, Vt. -- President Biden on Tuesday approved a major disaster declaration for Vermont that makes federal funding available to help people and communities affected by flooding from July 9 through July 11 caused by the remnants of Hurricane Beryl.
Phil Scott has made a separate disaster declaration request for flood damage caused by storms on July 30.
The declaration makes federal funding available to people in Addison, Caledonia, Chittenden, Essex, Lamoille, Orleans and Washington counties, federal officials said.
It also includes funding to help communities in those counties repair flood-damaged roads and bridges.
He has also asked for a separate natural disaster designation from the U.S. Department of Agriculture to help farmers hit by flooding in multiple counties.

title: More Than 1 Million Left Without Running Water After Hurricane Fiona Ripped Through The Dominican Republic
message:
(CNN) — Hurricane Fiona is continuing its ruinous path Tuesday after devastating Puerto Rico with flooding rain then ripping through the Dominican Republic, where more than a million people were left without running water and dozens of homes were destroyed.
At least three people have died the severe weather, including one in the French territory of Guadeloupe and two in Puerto Rico, according to officials.
Juan Miguel Gonzalez, a business owner in Puerto Rico told CNN that his neighborhood had still not finished its recovery from Maria when Fiona struck.
Emergency crews battled against unrelenting rain to rescue approximately 1,000 people as of midday Monday, said Maj. Gen. José Reyes, adjutant general of the Puerto Rico National Guard.
New York Governor Kathy Hochul also announced the state would send 100 state troopers to assist relief efforts in Puerto Rico.

title: Disaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of Beryl
message:
Disaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of BerylFILE - Two men dig out an SUV stuck in the mud along Hudson Avenue after remnants of Hurricane Beryl caused flooding and destruction, July 12, 2024, in Plainfield, Vt. (AP Photo/Charles Krupa, file)MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) — President Biden on Tuesday approved a major disaster declaration for Vermont that makes federal funding available to help people and communities affected by flooding from July 9 through July 11 caused by the remnants of Hurricane Beryl.
Phil Scott has made a separate disaster declaration request for flood damage caused by storms on July 30.
The declaration makes federal funding available to people in Addison, Caledonia, Chittenden, Essex, Lamoille, Orleans and Washington counties, federal officials said.
It also includes funding to help communities in those counties repair flood-damaged roads and bridges.
He has also asked for a separate natural disaster designation from the U.S. Department of Agriculture to help farmers hit by flooding in multiple counties.

title: Harris County sues Houston - area gas stations for alleged price gouging during Hurricane Beryl – Houston Public Media
message:
Two Shell gas stations, one located in Bellaire and the other in Baytown, are accused of price gouging during the storm.
Harris County Attorney Christian Menefee on Monday filed lawsuits against two Houston-area gas stations for alleged price gouging during Hurricane Beryl.
According to Menefee, his office received more than 250 complaints of price gouging following the hurricane, which left millions without power throughout the Houston region.
However, only two businesses refused to comply: two Shell gas stations, one located in Bellaire and the other in Baytown.
The Baytown location was allegedly selling premium gasoline for $5.49 per gallon, which is 44% higher than the gas station’s pre-hurricane price of $3.80.

On one night, two places in the Northeast get hit with 1-in-1,000 year rainfallIn two places on the same night, the storm that deluged the Northeast this weekend dumped rain at or near rates that should be expected only once in a thousand years.
It dropped about 10 inches of rain over 12 hours on Sunday in parts of Connecticut including Oxford and Southbury.
About 35 miles away, about 6.7 inches of rain fell in three hours on Sunday night in Stony Brook, New York.
Mona Hemmati, a postdoctoral research scientist at Columbia University in New York City, said that's a relatively unusual setup for extreme rainfall.
Bassill said New York City’s sewer pipes are designed to handle about 1.75 inches of rainfall per hour.

title: Horry County returns to OPCON2 , closes emergency operations center
message:
Horry County returned to OPCON 2 and transitioned to a partial, virtual Emergency Operations Center activation at noon on Tuesday to support continuing monitoring activities regarding Tropical Storm Debby flooding.
TOP STORY:Public Safety teams will continue to staff access control points as needed and patrol areas impacted by flooding.
County teams will begin damage assessments once flood waters recede.
Those with interests along area waterways should continue to monitor water levels until waterways are out of flood stage.
Additional information can be found on Horry County’s , page and .

title: Stree 2  beats  Khel Khel Mein  at the box office
message:
Published: Tue 20 Aug 2024, 2:00 PMLast week, Bollywood saw the release of three major films, but it was Stree 2 that quickly took the lead at the box office, with Khel Khel Mein and Vedaa struggling to keep up.
The Shraddha Kapoor and Rajkummar Rao-starrer, which faced a box-office clash with Khel Khel Mein and Vedaa on August 15, has quickly become the top choice for moviegoers, surpassing the other two by a huge margin.
On its first Sunday, the horror-comedy sequel earned an impressive Rs.58.20 crore, bringing its total collection to Rs.204 crore in just four days.
This massive success has left trade analysts stunned.
Taran Adarsh described the film's performance as a "storm" or "tsunami" that has swept away everything in its path.

title: London set to be battered by Hurricane Ernesto remnants | united kingdom News
message:
Up to 150mm of rain is expected in some parts if the country (Picture: Shutterstock)The UK is set to be battered by the remnants of Hurricane Ernesto this week, with heavy winds and rain set to put a dampener on the August summer holidays.
Hurricane Ernesto tore through the North Atlantic earlier this week, with winds of up to 100mph wreaking havoc in Bermuda and Puerto Rico and leaving thousands without power.
The Met Office has now issued a series of heavy rain warnings across the UK this week, with unsettled outbreaks of rain or showers spreading in from the west, the forecaster said.
Strong winds of up to 60mph are also likely to start on Friday, mostly affecting the west and north of the country.
Deputy Chief Meteorologist Tony Wisson added: ‘Newspaper headlines suggesting that Ernesto itself is set to batter Britain aren’t accurate.

title: Gov . Lamont submits request for federal emergency declaration
message:
HARTFORD, CT (WFSB) - Connecticut’s governor on Tuesday announced that an official request was submitted for a federal emergency declaration in the wake of the historic flooding from earlier this week.
Ned Lamont said the request was made to President Joe Biden and the Federal emergency Management Agency.
Lamont requested the support of direct federal help to supplement the state and its municipalities in meeting critical emergency protective requirements and providing restorative efforts that defend public safety.
Also, Lamont requested help from the Federal Highway Administration for the numerous destroyed and compromised state roads.
Under his authority, Lamont declared a civil preparedness emergency in response to the flooding on Monday.

title: Disaster declaration approved for Vermont for July flooding from remnants of Beryl
message:
MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) — President Biden on Tuesday approved a major disaster declaration for Vermont that makes federal funding available to help people and communities affected by flooding on July 9 and 10 caused by the remnants of Hurricane Beryl.
Phil Scott has made a separate disaster declaration request for flood damage caused by storms on July 30.
Beryl’s remnants dumped more than 6 inches (15 centimeters) of rain in just a few hours on parts of Vermont, destroying and damaging homes, knocking out bridges, cutting off towns and retraumatizing a state where some people are still awaiting assistance after catastrophic floods that hit exactly a year earlier.

message:

title: Wet and windy tomorrow night with possible flooding as Ireland in line for tail end of hurricane
message:
THE WEATHER IS expected to turn wet and windy tomorrow night as the remnants of Hurricane Ernesto make their way to Ireland’s shores.
Met Éireann is predicting heavy and persistent rain with a chance of flooding as the tail end of Ernest passes eastwards over the country.
AdvertisementOn top of the rain, the forecaster said there will be strong, gusty southerly winds that is expected to ease as the rain clears.
Lowest temperatures are expected to be between 12 and 16 degrees.
The last of the overnight rain and strong winds will clear from the east of the country early on Thursday morning, Met Éireann said.

title: Incredibly Rare  Doomsday Fish  Washes Up in La Jolla Cove
message:
And recently, beachgoers at La Jolla Cove were among a very select few humans who’ve ever laid eyes on one in person.
Known also as the “Doomsday Fish,” they are thought to be — by the superstitious, at least — a harbinger of disaster.
According to reports, it’s only the 20th time an oarfish has washed up in California since 1901.
As the world’s longest bony fish, they have been recorded up to 36 feet in length.
The dead fish will be examined by the Marine Vertebrate Collection at Scripps, and researchers are hoping to glean much-needed information about the animal.

title: Monsoonal moisture lingers , potential for gusty winds and hail in some parts
message:

title: First Alert Forecast | Taste of September on the way
message:
(WSAZ) - After the passage of a cold front, cool air is flooding into the region, allowing highs to only reach into the upper 70s today!
As high pressure works in from the north, northerly winds will only increase, and continue to reinforce late-September like air into the region.
Highs will only reach into the mid 70s tomorrow afternoon, with overnight lows dropping into the upper 40s and lower 50s.
This high pressure will work to the region’s south and east, eventually allowing for the development of southerly winds into the overall area.
As high pressure remains in control, we’ll be seeing fairly dry conditions throughout the entire forecast period, unfortunately exasperating drought conditions that we have seen over the entire summer.

title: TROPICS : Ernesto to dissipate soon . Is anything else out there ?
message:
Ernesto is now a post-tropical cyclone in the north Atlantic and traveling towards Europe.
The storm is taking on extreme shear and is absolutely falling apart.
Post-tropical Ernesto 11am updateTRACKING THE TROPICS: Hurricane Center | Hurricane GuideLater today, it will lose all of its tropical characteristics as upper level wind shear and very cold ocean temperatures take a toll on the former Category 2 hurricane.
By tomorrow, the system will get absorbed into a larger area of low pressure and fully dissipate.
The rest of the tropics remain quiet for now.

title: New Zealand sheep and cattle numbers down as carbon forestry , drought and low prices affect sector
message:

Beef and Lamb New Zealand chairwoman Kate Acland said with no recovery in sheep numbers in sight the flow on effects will continue.
Photo / RNZ, Carole StilesDespite beef prices performing really well this year, beef cattle numbers fell 2.8% to 3.55 million in the year to the end of June.
Like the drop in sheep numbers, Canterbury and Marlborough had the biggest dip in cattle numbers at 10.7% due to drought-reducing feed levels.

message:

title: Tens of thousands remain without power in Puerto Rico after tropical storm
message:
Tens of thousands of customers are still without power across Puerto Rico, a week after Ernesto swiped the U.S. territory as a tropical stormTens of thousands remain without power in Puerto Rico after tropical stormSAN JUAN, Puerto Rico -- Tens of thousands of customers remained without power across Puerto Rico on Tuesday, a week after Ernesto swiped the U.S. territory as a tropical storm.
Up to 70,000 clients could be temporarily left in the dark late Tuesday, and another 90,000 were already hit Monday by a manual reduction in power to Puerto Rico's grid.
Luma has come under fire ever since it took over transmission and distribution in June 2021 as Puerto Rico’s Electric Power Authority struggles to restructure more than $9 billion in debt.
During the storm, which spun past the island last Tuesday and Wednesday, a peak of 750,000 clients were without power.
Puerto Rico’s Energy Bureau questioned why the average outage duration per customer increased by 9% from fiscal year 2023 to 2024, for a total of 1,448 minutes.

Shoplifting in England and Wales reached a record high in 2024, a phenomenon Prof Taylor has dubbed the “tsunami of shop theft”, bringing it to the highest level in 20 years.

title: African Development Bank Group and African Risk Capacity Group Issue $11 . 2 Million Insurance Payout to the Government of Malawi [ announcement ]
message:
Representatives of the African Risk Capacity (ARC) Group and the African Development Bank have presented a cheque to the government of Malawi for an insurance payout of $11.2 million , to support the country's recovery from a devastating drought arising from a weather condition known as El-Nino.
The insurance payment, made in response to the government's drought insurance policy, was financed by the African Development Bank through its African Development Fund and its Africa Disaster Risk Financing (ADRiFi) Programme Multi-Donor Trust Fund .
The ADRiFi Trust Fund is a collaboration between the Bank Group and the ARC Group , an Agency of the African Union that supports African governments to improve their capacities to better plan, prepare, and respond to extreme weather events and natural disasters.
"The devastating El-Nino-driven southern African drought underscores the critical need for preparedness in the face of escalating weather-related disasters", said Ibrahima Cheikh Diong , UN Assistant Secretary General and ARC Group Director General.
By September 2024 , the African Risk Capacity Group is expected to have paid a total of $62 million in disaster risk insurance payouts to El Niño-impacted countries in Southern Africa , including Malawi ( $11.6 million ), Mozambique ( $5.5 million ), Zambia ( $13.3 million ) and Zimbabwe ( $31.8 million ).

title: Wildfire that burned 15 structures near Arizona town was caused by railroad work , investigators say
message:
Wildfire that burned 15 structures near Arizona town was caused by railroad work, investigators sayPHOENIX — A wildfire that burned 15 structures near the Arizona town of Wickenburg two months ago and cost nearly $1 million to suppress was caused by railroad work, authorities said Monday.
Investigators found a section of cut railroad track from work along the BNSF rail line, the Arizona Department of Forestry and Fire Management said.
The investigators concluded that the Rose Fire started from sparks caused by a welder, grinder or torch used to cut it, said Tiffany Davila, spokesperson for the department.
They determined that that area was the point of origin based on how the fire moved away from the tracks.
“Fires along our rail line are infrequent, but we work hard to try and prevent them,” BNSF spokesperson Kendall Sloan said in a statement.

title: What insurance claims can be made after flood damage ?
message:
Unfortunately, there’s a common misconception many consumers don’t realize until it’s too late: homeowners insurance typically does not cover flood damage.
Flood insurance can be purchased through the National Flood Insurance Program or a private flood insurer.
The Connecticut Insurance Department says damage like we’re seeing from the weekend is a good reminder to consumers of the value of flood insurance.
O'Sullivan added, “Most homeowners insurance policies don't cover flood damage, so opting for flood insurance through the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP) is the best way to safeguard your property and belongings.”There is a 30-day waiting period for National Flood Insurance Program coverage, meaning you can’t wait until a storm is right at your doorstep to get coverage.
Connecticut Insurance Department has information about flood insurance on its website and can help consumers with claims.

title: Tenerife warns united kingdom tourists  do not  and introduces  emergency restrictions
message:
UK tourists have been warned "do not" drink water in Spain amid ongoing restrictions.
European Union holidaymakers have been warned an ongoing drought on the holiday island of Tenerife has forced the local government to bring in emergency water restrictions for more than 5,000 people.
La Guancha, in the north of the island, yesterday announced tap water must not be used for personal use until further notice.
Always use bottled water for drinking but did use tap water for cooking etc.

title: Heavy rain could bring  dangerous condition to Inverclyde
message:
A yellow weather warning will be in place for much of the west of Scotland from 9am tomorrow until 3pm on Thursday.
The Met Office says remnants of Hurricane Ernesto, which ripped through the North Atlantic last week, will play a ‘background role’ in the stormy conditions.
Chief meteorologist Jason Kelly said: “A band of rain will move in from the west on Wednesday morning and will become slow moving with heavy bursts of rain at times, especially over high ground in Scotland.
Mr Kelly added: “Gusty winds will accompany the rain, with 50-60mph possible near Irish Sea coasts and the west of Scotland.
“Coupled with spring tides, this could lead to some dangerous coastal conditions before winds gradually ease later on Thursday.”

title: Lowville : 4 inches of rain , more flooding , more pain
message:
WATERTOWN, New York (WWNY) - A month after flash flooding caused severe damage in Lowville, the community has been hit hard again.
The National Weather Service reports the village saw 3.74 inches of rain during Monday’s storm.
Lowville Academy & Central School, which just dried out from July’s flood waters, will have to start over.
Meanwhile, on Trinity Avenue, hit hard in July, homeowners were pumping out their basements again.
That is a big part of the problem and a lot of the infrastructure that really got hit hard a few weeks ago is really not up to speed and repaired.

title: Wildfires rage across British Columbia , Canada - Xinhua
message:
Aerial photo provided by BC Wildfire Service shows wildfires near Corya Creek, northwest British Columbia, Canada, on Aug. 16, 2024.
Until Aug. 19, there are 375 active wildfires burning, with 127 out of control, across British Columbia in Canada, according to the BC Wildfire Service.

title: Lake City receives $13 . 5 million grant for water infrastructure upgrades
message:
On Tuesday, U.S. Secretary Gina Raimondo announced that the Department's Economic Development Administration is awarding Lake City a $13.5 million grant for water infrastructure improvements needed to support local businesses.
The EDA investment will be matched with $1.3 million in local funds.
The grant will help alleviate flooding in the downtown area and reduce structural and economic damage to businesses and homes.
TRENDING:Under the Disaster Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2023, the EDA was provided with $438 million in additional Economic Adjustment Assistance.
